step1_initial_points.title: Lawyer Productivity Drain on Repetitive Tasks
step1_initial_points.description: Highly skilled lawyers spend significant time on low-value, manual tasks like document summarization, drafting standard communications, and preliminary analysis, limiting their focus on complex legal work and strategic advice.

step1_initial_points.title: Inadequate Knowledge & Precedent Discovery
step1_initial_points.description: Current systems make it difficult to quickly find relevant internal knowledge, legal opinions, and precedents across a vast corpus of documents, slowing down case preparation and leading to inconsistent work.

step1_initial_points.title: Stringent Government Security & Data Sovereignty
step1_initial_points.description: As a government entity, any solution must adhere to strict security protocols, including IRAP certification at PROTECTED level, Essential Eight, and absolute data sovereignty with all data stored and processed within Australia.

step1_initial_points.title: Complex Integration with Existing Systems
step1_initial_points.description: New tools must supplement, not replace, the existing technology stack. Seamless integration with core platforms like iManage Cloud, Elite 3E, and Microsoft Office is critical to avoid disruption and ensure user adoption.

step1_initial_points.title: AI Governance and Ethical Compliance Burden
step1_initial_points.description: Implementing AI requires navigating a complex regulatory landscape. The solution must provide ethical, responsible, transparent, and explainable AI to comply with government policies and maintain public trust.

step1_initial_points.title: Inefficient Internal Business Operations
step1_initial_points.description: Manual processes for internal functions like resource and capacity allocation, style guide enforcement, and generating rotation rosters are inefficient and consume valuable administrative time.

step1_initial_points.title: Need for Australian-Specific Legal AI
step1_initial_points.description: Generic AI tools lack the necessary context for the Australian legal system. The buyer requires a solution specifically designed or trained to support the nuances of Australian legal practices and terminology.

step1_initial_points.title: Demand for Advanced AI Beyond Simple Generation
step1_initial_points.description: AGS is looking beyond standard generative AI to emerging 'agentic AI' systems capable of autonomous, multi-step task execution, indicating a need to solve more complex workflows that current tools cannot handle.

step1_initial_points.title: Ensuring High Availability & Business Continuity
step1_initial_points.description: The solution must be highly scalable for 1,000 concurrent users and meet strict Recovery Time (8 hours) and Recovery Point (4 hours) objectives, with no downtime for updates during business hours.
